The temperature on Earth would decrease by an average of 10 degrees Celsius.
Plants would not receive enough sunlight to grow, causing a significant decrease in plant life and potentially leading to a food shortage.
The ocean temperature would decrease, causing the polar ice caps to melt at a faster rate, leading to rising sea levels.
The solar wind, which is a stream of charged particles that the sun emits, would decrease, causing disruptions in communication and navigation systems.
The sun's disappearance would have a profound impact on our mental health, as it would disrupt our naturalthymic cycle and affect our moods and emotions.
